intro: Ceodes gigantocarpa, commonly known as the giant seed tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andes mountains of South America, specifically in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, woody structure and distinctive, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a large, indehiscent capsule that contains numerous seeds. Due to its size and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
